subtitle: Hi, I'm Scott. Welcome to my site.
I studied architecture and engineering in
university and began working in the AEC
industry as a draftsman.
Since then, I've taken on many roles as
my interest grew and my capabilities
expanded. As a triple amputee since
birth, I've been integrated with rapidly
evolving prosthetic technology for many
decades. So natural is this for me that
few ever realized that I walk on
artificial legs.
Having my body integrated with machines
from a young age has given me an uncommon
appreciation and intuition for all things
technological. Overcoming physical
challenges such as walking on two
artificial legs and changing congenital
handedness from right to left has also
forced my brain hemispheres to be wired
differently than most.
Life forced me to challenge established
ways of thinking and creatively adapt to
solve problems. Thinking differently has
given me an unusual ability to focus,
make links, and recognize patterns.
My physical handicap is therefore also my
cognitive superpower.
I've used this superpower to become
something of a modern day renaissance
man, embracing knowledge in many
different subject areas.
By developing skills in both arts and
sciences, I've become an expert in a wide
range of applications used in several
different industries. I've taught many of
these programs in person to thousands of
young adults, adults seeking continuing
education, and some of the best and
brightest international corporate and
government clients.
I can help you to improve your skills in
many subject areas.
I've also created dozens of professional
video courses with millions of viewers
worldwide posted on many platforms.
I've written or co-authored two dozen
books, 14 of which are on software and
the remainder on Leonardo da Vinci, the
Golden Ratio, Sacred Geometry and much
more. My Passion projects also include a
documentary series is called Secrets in
Plain Sight, examining Patterns in Art,
Architecture, Urban Design and the
Cosmos. Together, they have over 12
million views. I sell my own open-source
CAD software called Q for studying
geometry for its unique qualia.
Plus, I manufacturer a beautiful handheld
instrument called The Proportioner for
discovering and encoding the golden
ratio. I also offer online courses and
in-person workshops on sacred geometry
for those interested in embracing this
purest form of knowledge to help develop
themselves as fully as possible.
Please take a look around and I'm sure
you'll find much here that will spark
your interest.
